Name: Dry Daiquiri
Ingredients: 50 ml Light gold rum (1-3 year old molasses column)
10 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Review: Passion fruit syrup is powerful stuff and its fruity richness greatly enhances and balances this bittersweet cocktail.
History: Adapted from a recipe created circa 2005 by Kevin Armstrong at Match Bar in London, England. The Dry Daiquiri started its course towards becoming a contemporary classic cocktail in 2006/7 when it was added to the menu at Trailer Happiness over in London's Notting Hill.
Nutrition: One serving of Dry Daiquiri contains 176 calories
